lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Now is the winter of our discontent
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Made glorious summer by this sun of York;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And all the clouds that lour'd upon our house
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: In the deep bosom of the ocean buried.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Now are our brows bound with victorious wreaths;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Our bruised arms hung up for monuments;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Our stern alarums changed to merry meetings,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Our dreadful marches to delightful measures.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Grim-visaged war hath smooth'd his wrinkled front;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And now, instead of mounting barbed steeds
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To fright the souls of fearful adversaries,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: He capers nimbly in a lady's chamber
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To the lascivious pleasing of a lute.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: But I, that am not shaped for sportive tricks,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Nor made to court an amorous looking-glass;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I, that am rudely stamp'd, and want love's majesty
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To strut before a wanton ambling nymph;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I, that am curtail'd of this fair proportion,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Cheated of feature by dissembling nature,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Deformed, unfinish'd, sent before my time
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Into this breathing world, scarce half made up,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And that so lamely and unfashionable
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That dogs bark at me as I halt by them;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Why, I, in this weak piping time of peace,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Have no delight to pass away the time,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Unless to spy my shadow in the sun
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And descant on mine own deformity:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And therefore, since I cannot prove a lover,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To entertain these fair well-spoken days,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I am determined to prove a villain
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And hate the idle pleasures of these days.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Plots have I laid, inductions dangerous,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: By drunken prophecies, libels and dreams,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To set my brother Clarence and the king
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: In deadly hate the one against the other:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And if King Edward be as true and just
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: As I am subtle, false and treacherous,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: This day should Clarence closely be mew'd up,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: About a prophecy, which says that 'G'
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Of Edward's heirs the murderer shall be.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Dive, thoughts, down to my soul: here
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Clarence comes.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Brother, good day; what means this armed guard
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That waits upon your grace?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: CLARENCE
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: His majesty
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: Tendering my person's safety, hath appointed
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: This conduct to convey me to the Tower.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Upon what cause?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: CLARENCE
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: Because my name is George.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Alack, my lord, that fault is none of yours;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: He should, for that, commit your godfathers:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: O, belike his majesty hath some intent
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That you shall be new-christen'd in the Tower.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: But what's the matter, Clarence?  may I know?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: CLARENCE
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: Yea, Richard, when I know; for I protest
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: As yet I do not: but, as I can learn,
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: He hearkens after prophecies and dreams;
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: And from the cross-row plucks the letter G.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: And says a wizard told him that by G
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: His issue disinherited should be;
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: And, for my name of George begins with G,
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: It follows in his thought that I am he.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: These, as I learn, and such like toys as these
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: Have moved his highness to commit me now.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Why, this it is, when men are ruled by women:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: 'Tis not the king that sends you to the Tower:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: My Lady Grey his wife, Clarence, 'tis she
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That tempers him to this extremity.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Was it not she and that good man of worship,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Anthony Woodville, her brother there,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That made him send Lord Hastings to the Tower,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: From whence this present day he is deliver'd?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: We are not safe, Clarence; we are not safe.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: CLARENCE
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: By heaven, I think there's no man is secure
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: But the queen's kindred and night-walking heralds
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: That trudge betwixt the king and Mistress Shore.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: Heard ye not what an humble suppliant
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: Lord hastings was to her for his delivery?
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Humbly complaining to her deity
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Got my lord chamberlain his liberty.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I'll tell you what; I think it is our way,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: If we will keep in favour with the king,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To be her men and wear her livery:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: The jealous o'erworn widow and herself,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Since that our brother dubb'd them gentlewomen.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Are mighty gossips in this monarchy.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: BRAKENBURY
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: I beseech your graces both to pardon me;
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: His majesty hath straitly given in charge
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: That no man shall have private conference,
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: Of what degree soever, with his brother.
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Even so; an't please your worship, Brakenbury,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: You may partake of any thing we say:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: We speak no treason, man: we say the king
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Is wise and virtuous, and his noble queen
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Well struck in years, fair, and not jealous;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: We say that Shore's wife hath a pretty foot,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: A cherry lip, a bonny eye, a passing pleasing tongue;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And that the queen's kindred are made gentle-folks:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: How say you sir? Can you deny all this?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: BRAKENBURY
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: With this, my lord, myself have nought to do.
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Naught to do with mistress Shore! I tell thee, fellow,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: He that doth naught with her, excepting one,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Were best he do it secretly, alone.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: BRAKENBURY
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: What one, my lord?
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Her husband, knave: wouldst thou betray me?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: BRAKENBURY
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: I beseech your grace to pardon me, and withal
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: Forbear your conference with the noble duke.
lines.speaker: BRAKENBURY

lines.value: CLARENCE
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: We know thy charge, Brakenbury, and will obey.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: We are the queen's abjects, and must obey.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Brother, farewell: I will unto the king;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And whatsoever you will employ me in,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Were it to call King Edward's widow sister,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I will perform it to enfranchise you.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Meantime, this deep disgrace in brotherhood
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Touches me deeper than you can imagine.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: CLARENCE
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: I know it pleaseth neither of us well.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Well, your imprisonment shall not be long;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Meantime, have patience.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: CLARENCE
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: I must perforce. Farewell.
lines.speaker: CLARENCE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Go, tread the path that thou shalt ne'er return.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Simple, plain Clarence! I do love thee so,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That I will shortly send thy soul to heaven,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: If heaven will take the present at our hands.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: But who comes here? the new-deliver'd Hastings?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: HASTINGS
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: Good time of day unto my gracious lord!
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: As much unto my good lord chamberlain!
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Well are you welcome to the open air.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: How hath your lordship brook'd imprisonment?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: HASTINGS
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: With patience, noble lord, as prisoners must:
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: But I shall live, my lord, to give them thanks
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: That were the cause of my imprisonment.
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: No doubt, no doubt; and so shall Clarence too;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: For they that were your enemies are his,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And have prevail'd as much on him as you.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: HASTINGS
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: More pity that the eagle should be mew'd,
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: While kites and buzzards prey at liberty.
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: What news abroad?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: HASTINGS
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: No news so bad abroad as this at home;
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: The King is sickly, weak and melancholy,
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: And his physicians fear him mightily.
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Now, by Saint Paul, this news is bad indeed.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: O, he hath kept an evil diet long,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And overmuch consumed his royal person:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: 'Tis very grievous to be thought upon.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: What, is he in his bed?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: HASTINGS
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: He is.
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Go you before, and I will follow you.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: He cannot live, I hope; and must not die
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Till George be pack'd with post-horse up to heaven.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I'll in, to urge his hatred more to Clarence,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: With lies well steel'd with weighty arguments;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And, if I fall not in my deep intent,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Clarence hath not another day to live:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Which done, God take King Edward to his mercy,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And leave the world for me to bustle in!
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: For then I'll marry Warwick's youngest daughter.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: What though I kill'd her husband and her father?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: The readiest way to make the wench amends
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Is to become her husband and her father:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: The which will I; not all so much for love
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: As for another secret close intent,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: By marrying her which I must reach unto.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: But yet I run before my horse to market:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Clarence still breathes; Edward still lives and reigns:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: When they are gone, then must I count my gains.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Set down, set down your honourable load,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: If honour may be shrouded in a hearse,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Whilst I awhile obsequiously lament
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: The untimely fall of virtuous Lancaster.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Poor key-cold figure of a holy king!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Pale ashes of the house of Lancaster!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Thou bloodless remnant of that royal blood!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Be it lawful that I invocate thy ghost,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: To hear the lamentations of Poor Anne,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Wife to thy Edward, to thy slaughter'd son,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Stabb'd by the selfsame hand that made these wounds!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Lo, in these windows that let forth thy life,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: I pour the helpless balm of my poor eyes.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Cursed be the hand that made these fatal holes!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Cursed be the heart that had the heart to do it!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Cursed the blood that let this blood from hence!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: More direful hap betide that hated wretch,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: That makes us wretched by the death of thee,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Than I can wish to adders, spiders, toads,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Or any creeping venom'd thing that lives!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: If ever he have child, abortive be it,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Prodigious, and untimely brought to light,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Whose ugly and unnatural aspect
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: May fright the hopeful mother at the view;
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: And that be heir to his unhappiness!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: If ever he have wife, let her he made
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: A miserable by the death of him
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: As I am made by my poor lord and thee!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Come, now towards Chertsey with your holy load,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Taken from Paul's to be interred there;
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: And still, as you are weary of the weight,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Rest you, whiles I lament King Henry's corse.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Stay, you that bear the corse, and set it down.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: What black magician conjures up this fiend,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: To stop devoted charitable deeds?
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Villains, set down the corse; or, by Saint Paul,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I'll make a corse of him that disobeys.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Gentleman
lines.speaker: Gentleman

lines.value: My lord, stand back, and let the coffin pass.
lines.speaker: Gentleman

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Unmanner'd dog! stand thou, when I command:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Advance thy halbert higher than my breast,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Or, by Saint Paul, I'll strike thee to my foot,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And spurn upon thee, beggar, for thy boldness.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: What, do you tremble? are you all afraid?
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Alas, I blame you not; for you are mortal,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: And mortal eyes cannot endure the devil.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Avaunt, thou dreadful minister of hell!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Thou hadst but power over his mortal body,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: His soul thou canst not have; therefore be gone.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Sweet saint, for charity, be not so curst.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Foul devil, for God's sake, hence, and trouble us not;
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: For thou hast made the happy earth thy hell,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Fill'd it with cursing cries and deep exclaims.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: If thou delight to view thy heinous deeds,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Behold this pattern of thy butcheries.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: O, gentlemen, see, see! dead Henry's wounds
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Open their congeal'd mouths and bleed afresh!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Blush, Blush, thou lump of foul deformity;
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: For 'tis thy presence that exhales this blood
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: From cold and empty veins, where no blood dwells;
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Thy deed, inhuman and unnatural,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Provokes this deluge most unnatural.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: O God, which this blood madest, revenge his death!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: O earth, which this blood drink'st revenge his death!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Either heaven with lightning strike the
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: murderer dead,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Or earth, gape open wide and eat him quick,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: As thou dost swallow up this good king's blood
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Which his hell-govern'd arm hath butchered!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Lady, you know no rules of charity,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Which renders good for bad, blessings for curses.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Villain, thou know'st no law of God nor man:
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: No beast so fierce but knows some touch of pity.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: But I know none, and therefore am no beast.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: O wonderful, when devils tell the truth!
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: More wonderful, when angels are so angry.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Vouchsafe, divine perfection of a woman,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Of these supposed-evils, to give me leave,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: By circumstance, but to acquit myself.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Vouchsafe, defused infection of a man,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: For these known evils, but to give me leave,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: By circumstance, to curse thy cursed self.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Fairer than tongue can name thee, let me have
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Some patient leisure to excuse myself.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Fouler than heart can think thee, thou canst make
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: No excuse current, but to hang thyself.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: By such despair, I should accuse myself.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: And, by despairing, shouldst thou stand excused;
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: For doing worthy vengeance on thyself,
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Which didst unworthy slaughter upon others.
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Say that I slew them not?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: LADY ANNE
lines.speaker: LADY ANNE

lines.value: Why, then they are not dead:

lines.value: They do me wrong, and I will not endure it:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Who are they that complain unto the king,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That I, forsooth, am stern, and love them not?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: By holy Paul, they love his grace but lightly
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That fill his ears with such dissentious rumours.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Because I cannot flatter and speak fair,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Smile in men's faces, smooth, deceive and cog,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Duck with French nods and apish courtesy,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I must be held a rancorous enemy.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Cannot a plain man live and think no harm,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: But thus his simple truth must be abused
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: By silken, sly, insinuating Jacks?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: RIVERS
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: To whom in all this presence speaks your grace?
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To thee, that hast nor honesty nor grace.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: When have I injured thee? when done thee wrong?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Or thee? or thee? or any of your faction?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: A plague upon you all! His royal person,--
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Whom God preserve better than you would wish!--
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Cannot be quiet scarce a breathing-while,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: But you must trouble him with lewd complaints.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Brother of Gloucester, you mistake the matter.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: The king, of his own royal disposition,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And not provoked by any suitor else;
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Aiming, belike, at your interior hatred,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Which in your outward actions shows itself
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Against my kindred, brothers, and myself,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Makes him to send; that thereby he may gather
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: The ground of your ill-will, and so remove it.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I cannot tell: the world is grown so bad,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That wrens make prey where eagles dare not perch:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Since every Jack became a gentleman
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: There's many a gentle person made a Jack.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Come, come, we know your meaning, brother
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Gloucester;
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: You envy my advancement and my friends':
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: God grant we never may have need of you!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Meantime, God grants that we have need of you:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Your brother is imprison'd by your means,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Myself disgraced, and the nobility
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Held in contempt; whilst many fair promotions
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Are daily given to ennoble those
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That scarce, some two days since, were worth a noble.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: By Him that raised me to this careful height
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: From that contented hap which I enjoy'd,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: I never did incense his majesty
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Against the Duke of Clarence, but have been
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: An earnest advocate to plead for him.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: My lord, you do me shameful injury,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Falsely to draw me in these vile suspects.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: You may deny that you were not the cause
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Of my Lord Hastings' late imprisonment.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: RIVERS
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: She may, my lord, for--
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: She may, Lord Rivers! why, who knows not so?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: She may do more, sir, than denying that:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: She may help you to many fair preferments,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And then deny her aiding hand therein,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And lay those honours on your high deserts.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: What may she not? She may, yea, marry, may she--
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: RIVERS
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: What, marry, may she?
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: What, marry, may she! marry with a king,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: A bachelor, a handsome stripling too:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I wis your grandam had a worser match.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: My Lord of Gloucester, I have too long borne
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Your blunt upbraidings and your bitter scoffs:
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: By heaven, I will acquaint his majesty
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: With those gross taunts I often have endured.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: I had rather be a country servant-maid
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Than a great queen, with this condition,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: To be thus taunted, scorn'd, and baited at:
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Small joy have I in being England's queen.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And lessen'd be that small, God, I beseech thee!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thy honour, state and seat is due to me.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: What! threat you me with telling of the king?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Tell him, and spare not: look, what I have said
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I will avouch in presence of the king:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I dare adventure to be sent to the Tower.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: 'Tis time to speak; my pains are quite forgot.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Out, devil! I remember them too well:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou slewest my husband Henry in the Tower,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And Edward, my poor son, at Tewksbury.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Ere you were queen, yea, or your husband king,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I was a pack-horse in his great affairs;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: A weeder-out of his proud adversaries,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: A liberal rewarder of his friends:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To royalize his blood I spilt mine own.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Yea, and much better blood than his or thine.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: In all which time you and your husband Grey
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Were factious for the house of Lancaster;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And, Rivers, so were you. Was not your husband
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: In Margaret's battle at Saint Alban's slain?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Let me put in your minds, if you forget,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: What you have been ere now, and what you are;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Withal, what I have been, and what I am.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A murderous villain, and so still thou art.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Poor Clarence did forsake his father, Warwick;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Yea, and forswore himself,--which Jesu pardon!--
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Which God revenge!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: To fight on Edward's party for the crown;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And for his meed, poor lord, he is mew'd up.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I would to God my heart were flint, like Edward's;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Or Edward's soft and pitiful, like mine
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I am too childish-foolish for this world.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Hie thee to hell for shame, and leave the world,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou cacodemon! there thy kingdom is.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: RIVERS
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: My Lord of Gloucester, in those busy days
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: Which here you urge to prove us enemies,
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: We follow'd then our lord, our lawful king:
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: So should we you, if you should be our king.
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: If I should be! I had rather be a pedlar:
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Far be it from my heart, the thought of it!
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: As little joy, my lord, as you suppose
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: You should enjoy, were you this country's king,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: As little joy may you suppose in me.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: That I enjoy, being the queen thereof.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A little joy enjoys the queen thereof;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For I am she, and altogether joyless.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: I can no longer hold me patient.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Hear me, you wrangling pirates, that fall out
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: In sharing that which you have pill'd from me!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Which of you trembles not that looks on me?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: If not, that, I being queen, you bow like subjects,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Yet that, by you deposed, you quake like rebels?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: O gentle villain, do not turn away!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Foul wrinkled witch, what makest thou in my sight?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: But repetition of what thou hast marr'd;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That will I make before I let thee go.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Wert thou not banished on pain of death?
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: I was; but I do find more pain in banishment
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Than death can yield me here by my abode.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A husband and a son thou owest to me;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And thou a kingdom; all of you allegiance:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: The sorrow that I have, by right is yours,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And all the pleasures you usurp are mine.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: The curse my noble father laid on thee,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: When thou didst crown his warlike brows with paper
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And with thy scorns drew'st rivers from his eyes,
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And then, to dry them, gavest the duke a clout
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Steep'd in the faultless blood of pretty Rutland--
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: His curses, then from bitterness of soul
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Denounced against thee, are all fall'n upon thee;
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: And God, not we, hath plagued thy bloody deed.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: So just is God, to right the innocent.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: HASTINGS
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: O, 'twas the foulest deed to slay that babe,
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: And the most merciless that e'er was heard of!
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: RIVERS
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: Tyrants themselves wept when it was reported.
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: DORSET
lines.speaker: DORSET

lines.value: No man but prophesied revenge for it.
lines.speaker: DORSET

lines.value: BUCKINGHAM
lines.speaker: BUCKINGHAM

lines.value: Northumberland, then present, wept to see it.
lines.speaker: BUCKINGHAM

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: What were you snarling all before I came,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Ready to catch each other by the throat,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And turn you all your hatred now on me?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Did York's dread curse prevail so much with heaven?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That Henry's death, my lovely Edward's death,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Their kingdom's loss, my woful banishment,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Could all but answer for that peevish brat?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Can curses pierce the clouds and enter heaven?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Why, then, give way, dull clouds, to my quick curses!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: If not by war, by surfeit die your king,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: As ours by murder, to make him a king!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Edward thy son, which now is Prince of Wales,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For Edward my son, which was Prince of Wales,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Die in his youth by like untimely violence!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thyself a queen, for me that was a queen,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Outlive thy glory, like my wretched self!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Long mayst thou live to wail thy children's loss;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And see another, as I see thee now,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Deck'd in thy rights, as thou art stall'd in mine!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Long die thy happy days before thy death;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And, after many lengthen'd hours of grief,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Die neither mother, wife, nor England's queen!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Rivers and Dorset, you were standers by,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And so wast thou, Lord Hastings, when my son
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Was stabb'd with bloody daggers: God, I pray him,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That none of you may live your natural age,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: But by some unlook'd accident cut off!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Have done thy charm, thou hateful wither'd hag!
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And leave out thee? stay, dog, for thou shalt hear me.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: If heaven have any grievous plague in store
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Exceeding those that I can wish upon thee,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: O, let them keep it till thy sins be ripe,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And then hurl down their indignation
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: On thee, the troubler of the poor world's peace!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: The worm of conscience still begnaw thy soul!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thy friends suspect for traitors while thou livest,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And take deep traitors for thy dearest friends!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Unless it be whilst some tormenting dream
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Affrights thee with a hell of ugly devils!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou elvish-mark'd, abortive, rooting hog!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou that wast seal'd in thy nativity
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: The slave of nature and the son of hell!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou slander of thy mother's heavy womb!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou loathed issue of thy father's loins!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou rag of honour! thou detested--
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Margaret.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Richard!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Ha!
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: I call thee not.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: I cry thee mercy then, for I had thought
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: That thou hadst call'd me all these bitter names.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Why, so I did; but look'd for no reply.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: O, let me make the period to my curse!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: 'Tis done by me, and ends in 'Margaret.'
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Thus have you breathed your curse against yourself.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Poor painted queen, vain flourish of my fortune!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: HASTINGS
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: False-boding woman, end thy frantic curse,

lines.value: Lest to thy harm thou move our patience.
lines.speaker: HASTINGS

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: RIVERS
lines.speaker: RIVERS

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Teach me to be your queen, and you my subjects:

lines.value: DORSET
lines.speaker: DORSET

lines.value: Dispute not with her; she is lunatic.

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: Good counsel, marry: learn it, learn it, marquess.
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.value: DORSET
lines.speaker: DORSET

lines.value: It toucheth you, my lord, as much as me.
lines.speaker: DORSET

lines.value: GLOUCESTER
lines.speaker: GLOUCESTER

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: O God, that seest it, do not suffer it!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: As it was won with blood, lost be it so!

lines.value: Jove's Mercury, and herald for a king!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Come, muster men: my counsel is my shield;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: We must be brief when traitors brave the field.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: So, now prosperity begins to mellow
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And drop into the rotten mouth of death.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Here in these confines slily have I lurk'd,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: To watch the waning of mine adversaries.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A dire induction am I witness to,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And will to France, hoping the consequence
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Will prove as bitter, black, and tragical.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Withdraw thee, wretched Margaret: who comes here?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Ah, my young princes! ah, my tender babes!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: My unblown flowers, new-appearing sweets!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: If yet your gentle souls fly in the air
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And be not fix'd in doom perpetual,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Hover about me with your airy wings
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And hear your mother's lamentation!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Hover about her; say, that right for right
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Hath dimm'd your infant morn to aged night.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: So many miseries have crazed my voice,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: That my woe-wearied tongue is mute and dumb,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Edward Plantagenet, why art thou dead?
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Plantagenet doth quit Plantagenet.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Edward for Edward pays a dying debt.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Wilt thou, O God, fly from such gentle lambs,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And throw them in the entrails of the wolf?
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: When didst thou sleep when such a deed was done?
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: When holy Harry died, and my sweet son.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Blind sight, dead life, poor mortal living ghost,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Woe's scene, world's shame, grave's due by life usurp'd,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Brief abstract and record of tedious days,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Rest thy unrest on England's lawful earth,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Unlawfully made drunk with innocents' blood!
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: O, that thou wouldst as well afford a grave
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: As thou canst yield a melancholy seat!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Then would I hide my bones, not rest them here.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: O, who hath any cause to mourn but I?
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: If ancient sorrow be most reverend,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Give mine the benefit of seniory,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And let my woes frown on the upper hand.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: If sorrow can admit society,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Tell o'er your woes again by viewing mine:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: I had an Edward, till a Richard kill'd him;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: I had a Harry, till a Richard kill'd him:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou hadst an Edward, till a Richard kill'd him;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou hadst a Richard, till a Richard killed him;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: I had a Richard too, and thou didst kill him;
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: I had a Rutland too, thou holp'st to kill him.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou hadst a Clarence too, and Richard kill'd him.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: From forth the kennel of thy womb hath crept
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A hell-hound that doth hunt us all to death:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That dog, that had his teeth before his eyes,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: To worry lambs and lap their gentle blood,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That foul defacer of God's handiwork,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That excellent grand tyrant of the earth,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That reigns in galled eyes of weeping souls,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thy womb let loose, to chase us to our graves.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: O upright, just, and true-disposing God,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: How do I thank thee, that this carnal cur
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Preys on the issue of his mother's body,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And makes her pew-fellow with others' moan!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: O Harry's wife, triumph not in my woes!
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: God witness with me, I have wept for thine.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Bear with me; I am hungry for revenge,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And now I cloy me with beholding it.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thy Edward he is dead, that stabb'd my Edward:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thy other Edward dead, to quit my Edward;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Young York he is but boot, because both they
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Match not the high perfection of my loss:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thy Clarence he is dead that kill'd my Edward;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And the beholders of this tragic play,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: The adulterate Hastings, Rivers, Vaughan, Grey,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Untimely smother'd in their dusky graves.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Richard yet lives, hell's black intelligencer,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Only reserved their factor, to buy souls
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And send them thither: but at hand, at hand,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Ensues his piteous and unpitied end:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Earth gapes, hell burns, fiends roar, saints pray.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: To have him suddenly convey'd away.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Cancel his bond of life, dear God, I prey,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: That I may live to say, The dog is dead!
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: O, thou didst prophesy the time would come
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: That I should wish for thee to help me curse
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: That bottled spider, that foul bunch-back'd toad!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: I call'd thee then vain flourish of my fortune;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: I call'd thee then poor shadow, painted queen;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: The presentation of but what I was;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: The flattering index of a direful pageant;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: One heaved a-high, to be hurl'd down below;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A mother only mock'd with two sweet babes;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A dream of what thou wert, a breath, a bubble,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A sign of dignity, a garish flag,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: To be the aim of every dangerous shot,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: A queen in jest, only to fill the scene.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Where is thy husband now? where be thy brothers?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Where are thy children? wherein dost thou, joy?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Who sues to thee and cries 'God save the queen'?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Where be the bending peers that flatter'd thee?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Where be the thronging troops that follow'd thee?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Decline all this, and see what now thou art:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For happy wife, a most distressed widow;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For joyful mother, one that wails the name;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For queen, a very caitiff crown'd with care;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For one being sued to, one that humbly sues;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For one that scorn'd at me, now scorn'd of me;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For one being fear'd of all, now fearing one;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: For one commanding all, obey'd of none.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thus hath the course of justice wheel'd about,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And left thee but a very prey to time;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Having no more but thought of what thou wert,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: To torture thee the more, being what thou art.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thou didst usurp my place, and dost thou not
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Usurp the just proportion of my sorrow?
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Now thy proud neck bears half my burthen'd yoke;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: From which even here I slip my weary neck,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And leave the burthen of it all on thee.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Farewell, York's wife, and queen of sad mischance:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: These English woes will make me smile in France.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: O thou well skill'd in curses, stay awhile,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And teach me how to curse mine enemies!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Forbear to sleep the nights, and fast the days;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Compare dead happiness with living woe;
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Think that thy babes were fairer than they were,
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: And he that slew them fouler than he is:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Bettering thy loss makes the bad causer worse:
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Revolving this will teach thee how to curse.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: My words are dull; O, quicken them with thine!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: QUEEN MARGARET
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: Thy woes will make them sharp, and pierce like mine.
lines.speaker: QUEEN MARGARET

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Why should calamity be full of words?
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Windy attorneys to their client woes,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Airy succeeders of intestate joys,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Poor breathing orators of miseries!
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Let them have scope: though what they do impart
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Help not all, yet do they ease the heart.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: If so, then be not tongue-tied: go with me.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: And in the breath of bitter words let's smother
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: My damned son, which thy two sweet sons smother'd.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: I hear his drum: be copious in exclaims.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Who intercepts my expedition?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: O, she that might have intercepted thee,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: By strangling thee in her accursed womb
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: From all the slaughters, wretch, that thou hast done!
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Hidest thou that forehead with a golden crown,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Where should be graven, if that right were right,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: The slaughter of the prince that owed that crown,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And the dire death of my two sons and brothers?
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Tell me, thou villain slave, where are my children?
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Thou toad, thou toad, where is thy brother Clarence?
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: And little Ned Plantagenet, his son?
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Where is kind Hastings, Rivers, Vaughan, Grey?
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A flourish, trumpets! strike alarum, drums!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Let not the heavens hear these tell-tale women
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Rail on the Lord's enointed: strike, I say!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Either be patient, and entreat me fair,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Or with the clamorous report of war
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Thus will I drown your exclamations.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Art thou my son?
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Ay, I thank God, my father, and yourself.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Then patiently hear my impatience.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Madam, I have a touch of your condition,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Which cannot brook the accent of reproof.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: O, let me speak!
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Do then: but I'll not hear.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: I will be mild and gentle in my speech.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: And brief, good mother; for I am in haste.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Art thou so hasty? I have stay'd for thee,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: God knows, in anguish, pain and agony.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: And came I not at last to comfort you?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: No, by the holy rood, thou know'st it well,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Thou camest on earth to make the earth my hell.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: A grievous burthen was thy birth to me;
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Tetchy and wayward was thy infancy;
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Thy school-days frightful, desperate, wild, and furious,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Thy prime of manhood daring, bold, and venturous,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Thy age confirm'd, proud, subdued, bloody,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: treacherous,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: More mild, but yet more harmful, kind in hatred:
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: What comfortable hour canst thou name,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: That ever graced me in thy company?
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Faith, none, but Humphrey Hour, that call'd
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: your grace
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: To breakfast once forth of my company.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: If I be so disgracious in your sight,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Let me march on, and not offend your grace.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Strike the drum.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: I prithee, hear me speak.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: You speak too bitterly.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Hear me a word;
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: For I shall never speak to thee again.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: So.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: DUCHESS OF YORK
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Either thou wilt die, by God's just ordinance,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Ere from this war thou turn a conqueror,
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Or I with grief and extreme age shall perish
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: And never look upon thy face again.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Therefore take with thee my most heavy curse;
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Which, in the day of battle, tire thee more
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Than all the complete armour that thou wear'st!
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: My prayers on the adverse party fight;
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: And there the little souls of Edward's children
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Whisper the spirits of thine enemies
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: And promise them success and victory.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Bloody thou art, bloody will be thy end;
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: Shame serves thy life and doth thy death attend.
lines.speaker: DUCHESS OF YORK

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Though far more cause, yet much less spirit to curse
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Abides in me; I say amen to all.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Stay, madam; I must speak a word with you.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: I have no more sons of the royal blood
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: For thee to murder: for my daughters, Richard,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: They shall be praying nuns, not weeping queens;
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And therefore level not to hit their lives.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: You have a daughter call'd Elizabeth,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Virtuous and fair, royal and gracious.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And must she die for this? O, let her live,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And I'll corrupt her manners, stain her beauty;
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Slander myself as false to Edward's bed;
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: Throw over her the veil of infamy:
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: So she may live unscarr'd of bleeding slaughter,
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: I will confess she was not Edward's daughter.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Wrong not her birth, she is of royal blood.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: To save her life, I'll say she is not so.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Her life is only safest in her birth.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: And only in that safety died her brothers.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Lo, at their births good stars were opposite.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: No, to their lives bad friends were contrary.
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: All unavoided is the doom of destiny.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: QUEEN ELIZABETH
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: True, when avoided grace makes destiny:
lines.speaker: QUEEN ELIZABETH

lines.value: My babes were destined to a fairer death,

lines.speaker: RATCLIFF

lines.value: Not I, my lord.
lines.speaker: RATCLIFF

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Then he disdains to shine; for by the book
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: He should have braved the east an hour ago
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A black day will it be to somebody. Ratcliff!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: RATCLIFF
lines.speaker: RATCLIFF

lines.value: My lord?
lines.speaker: RATCLIFF

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: The sun will not be seen to-day;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: The sky doth frown and lour upon our army.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: I would these dewy tears were from the ground.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Not shine to-day! Why, what is that to me
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: More than to Richmond?  for the selfsame heaven
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: That frowns on me looks sadly upon him.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: NORFOLK
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: Arm, arm, my lord; the foe vaunts in the field.
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Come, bustle, bustle; caparison my horse.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Call up Lord Stanley, bid him bring his power:
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: I will lead forth my soldiers to the plain,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: And thus my battle shall be ordered:
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: My foreward shall be drawn out all in length,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Consisting equally of horse and foot;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Our archers shall be placed in the midst
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: John Duke of Norfolk, Thomas Earl of Surrey,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Shall have the leading of this foot and horse.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: They thus directed, we will follow
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: In the main battle, whose puissance on either side
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Shall be well winged with our chiefest horse.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: This, and Saint George to boot! What think'st thou, Norfolk?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: NORFOLK
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: A good direction, warlike sovereign.
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: This found I on my tent this morning.
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: [Reads]
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: 'Jockey of Norfolk, be not too bold,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: For Dickon thy master is bought and sold.'
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A thing devised by the enemy.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Go, gentleman, every man unto his charge
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Let not our babbling dreams affright our souls:
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Conscience is but a word that cowards use,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Devised at first to keep the strong in awe:
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Our strong arms be our conscience, swords our law.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: March on, join bravely, let us to't pell-mell
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: If not to heaven, then hand in hand to hell.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: What shall I say more than I have inferr'd?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Remember whom you are to cope withal;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A sort of vagabonds, rascals, and runaways,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A scum of Bretons, and base lackey peasants,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Whom their o'er-cloyed country vomits forth
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: To desperate ventures and assured destruction.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: You sleeping safe, they bring to you unrest;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: You having lands, and blest with beauteous wives,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: They would restrain the one, distain the other.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: And who doth lead them but a paltry fellow,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Long kept in Bretagne at our mother's cost?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A milk-sop, one that never in his life
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Felt so much cold as over shoes in snow?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Let's whip these stragglers o'er the seas again;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Lash hence these overweening rags of France,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: These famish'd beggars, weary of their lives;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Who, but for dreaming on this fond exploit,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: For want of means, poor rats, had hang'd themselves:
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: If we be conquer'd, let men conquer us,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: And not these bastard Bretons; whom our fathers
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Have in their own land beaten, bobb'd, and thump'd,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: And in record, left them the heirs of shame.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Shall these enjoy our lands?  lie with our wives?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Ravish our daughters?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Hark! I hear their drum.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Fight, gentlemen of England! fight, bold yoemen!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Draw, archers, draw your arrows to the head!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Spur your proud horses hard, and ride in blood;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Amaze the welkin with your broken staves!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: What says Lord Stanley? will he bring his power?
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: My lord, he doth deny to come.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Off with his son George's head!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: NORFOLK
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: My lord, the enemy is past the marsh
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: After the battle let George Stanley die.
lines.speaker: NORFOLK

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A thousand hearts are great within my bosom:
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Advance our standards, set upon our foes
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Our ancient word of courage, fair Saint George,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Inspire us with the spleen of fiery dragons!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Upon them! victory sits on our helms.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: CATESBY
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: Rescue, my Lord of Norfolk, rescue, rescue!
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: The king enacts more wonders than a man,
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: Daring an opposite to every danger:
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: His horse is slain, and all on foot he fights,
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: Seeking for Richmond in the throat of death.
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: Rescue, fair lord, or else the day is lost!
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: CATESBY
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: Withdraw, my lord; I'll help you to a horse.
lines.speaker: CATESBY

lines.value: KING RICHARD III
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Slave, I have set my life upon a cast,
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: And I will stand the hazard of the die:
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: I think there be six Richmonds in the field;
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: Five have I slain to-day instead of him.
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!
lines.speaker: KING RICHARD III

lines.value: RICHMOND
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: God and your arms be praised, victorious friends,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: The day is ours, the bloody dog is dead.
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: DERBY
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: Courageous Richmond, well hast thou acquit thee.
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: Lo, here, this long-usurped royalty
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: From the dead temples of this bloody wretch
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: Have I pluck'd off, to grace thy brows withal:
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: Wear it, enjoy it, and make much of it.
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: RICHMOND
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Great God of heaven, say Amen to all!
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: But, tell me, is young George Stanley living?
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: DERBY
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: He is, my lord, and safe in Leicester town;
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: Whither, if it please you, we may now withdraw us.
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: RICHMOND
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: What men of name are slain on either side?
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: DERBY
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: John Duke of Norfolk, Walter Lord Ferrers,
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: Sir Robert Brakenbury, and Sir William Brandon.
lines.speaker: DERBY

lines.value: RICHMOND
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Inter their bodies as becomes their births:
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Proclaim a pardon to the soldiers fled
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: That in submission will return to us:
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: And then, as we have ta'en the sacrament,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: We will unite the white rose and the red:
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Smile heaven upon this fair conjunction,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: That long have frown'd upon their enmity!
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: What traitor hears me, and says not amen?
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: England hath long been mad, and scarr'd herself;
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: The brother blindly shed the brother's blood,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: The father rashly slaughter'd his own son,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: The son, compell'd, been butcher to the sire:
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: All this divided York and Lancaster,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Divided in their dire division,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: O, now, let Richmond and Elizabeth,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: The true succeeders of each royal house,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: By God's fair ordinance conjoin together!
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: And let their heirs, God, if thy will be so.
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Enrich the time to come with smooth-faced peace,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: With smiling plenty and fair prosperous days!
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Abate the edge of traitors, gracious Lord,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: That would reduce these bloody days again,
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: And make poor England weep in streams of blood!
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Let them not live to taste this land's increase
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: That would with treason wound this fair land's peace!
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: Now civil wounds are stopp'd, peace lives again:
lines.speaker: RICHMOND

lines.value: That she may long live here, God say amen!
lines.speaker: RICHMOND
